alert.note: Alert for Osborne; Rooks (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 25 at 8:56PM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 145 AM CDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of north central Kansas, including the following counties, Osborne and Rooks. * WHEN...Until 145 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 854 PM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 4 inches of rain have fallen in much of the area, but any additional amounts tonight should average well under 1 inch. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Kill Creek, Boxelder Creek, Medicine Creek, Elm Creek, Crooked Creek, Paradise Creek, Douglas Creek, Dibble Creek, Lucky Creek, Eagle Creek, Jim Creek and East Branch Jim Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Plainville, Stockton, Natoma, Woodston and Alton. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
